text: Arciso Artesiani (21 January 1922 - 16 March 2005) was an Italian professional Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. Born in Marzabotto, Emilia-Romagna, Artesiani competed from 1949 to 1951 riding a 500cc motorcycle for MV Agusta. In 1949, Artesiani finished the 500cc season in third place behind Leslie Graham and Nello Pagani.Arciso Artesiani career statistics at MotoGP.com == Placement in Motorcycle World Championship == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- class="hintergrundfarbe5" ! width="50px" | Season !! width="100px" | Class !! width="100px" | Result !! width="100px" | Machine !! width="50px" | Podium |- | 1949 || 500 cm³ || style="background:#ffdf9f;" | 3. || Gilera || 4 |- | 1950 || 500 cm³ || 8. || MV Agusta || 1 |- | 1951 || 500 cm³ || 13. || MV Agusta || 1 |} == References == Category:1922 births Category:People from the Province of Bologna Category:Italian motorcycle racers Category:500cc World Championship riders Category:2005 deaths
